name: UpdateTabularCubeDataSourceTask
friendlyName: Update SSAS tabular cube data source
description: Update SSAS tabular cube data source connection string to use an on-premise SQL Server database
author: Dr. John Tunnicliffe
instanceNameFormat: Update SSAS tabular cube data source in $(CubeDatabaseName)

inputs.name: AsServer
inputs.label: SSAS Server Name or IP address
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSAS Server Name or IP address.  Include the instance name and port if necessary (e.g. myserver\myinstance,myport)

inputs.name: CubeDatabaseName
inputs.label: Name of tabular cube containing the data source connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the tabular cube containing the data source connection

inputs.name: SourceSqlServer
inputs.label: Name of source SQL Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the SQL Server that will be the source of data for the cube

inputs.name: SourceSqlDatabase
inputs.label: Name of source SQL Database
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the SQL database that will be the source of data for the cube

inputs.name: ImpersonationMode
inputs.label: Impersonation mode to be used by the data source

options.ImpersonateAccount: Use a specfic Windows user and password

inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select an impersonation mode to be used by the connection:
'Use the SSAS service account' changes the impersonation to use the SSAS service account.
'Use a specfic Windows user and password' will show input fields to specify the username and password.  Strongly recommended that you use a domain based service account.

inputs.name: ImpersonationAccount
inputs.label: Windows Account Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Account name including the domain name e.g. mydomain\myserviceaccount

inputs.name: ImpersonationPassword
inputs.label: Windows Account Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use a locked variable for the password. Otherwise the password will be visible to all here!

inputs.name: AuthenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to authenticate with the SSAS/AAS server instance.

options.SQL: SQL Server or Azure SQL Authentication

inputs.name: AuthenticationUser
inputs.label: Authentication User ID for the SSAS/AAS server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The login ID for authenticating the connection to the Analysis Services instance

inputs.name: AuthenticationPassword
inputs.label: The Password for the Authentication User ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the password for the Authentication login ID that was specified in the Authentication User ID parameter. Please use a secured variable in this field.
